original_solution_mapping.L1: He needs 18 valentine's cards because 30 x .6 = <<30*.6=18>>18
original_solution_mapping.L2: He will spend $36 on these because 18 x 2 = <<18*2=36>>36
original_solution_mapping.L3: The proportion of his income spent is .9 because 36 / 40 = <<36/40=.9>>.9
original_solution_mapping.L4: This is 90% of his income because .9 x 100 = <<.9*100=90>>90

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2955.
    Returns: the percentage of money Mo will spend on Valentine's cards.
    """
    # L1
    num_students = 30 # 30 students
    percent_students_for_cards = 0.6 # 60% of them
    num_cards_needed = num_students * percent_students_for_cards

    # L2
    cost_per_card = 2 # $2 each
    total_cost_cards = num_cards_needed * cost_per_card

    # L3
    initial_money = 40 # he has $40
    proportion_spent = total_cost_cards / initial_money

    # L4
    percent_multiplier = 100 # WK
    percentage_spent = proportion_spent * percent_multiplier

    # FA
    answer = percentage_spent
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He needs {num_cards_needed} valentine's cards because {num_students} x {percent_students_for_cards} = <<{num_students}*{percent_students_for_cards}={num_cards_needed}>>{num_cards_needed}
He will spend ${total_cost_cards} on these because {num_cards_needed} x {cost_per_card} = <<{num_cards_needed}*{cost_per_card}={total_cost_cards}>>{total_cost_cards}
The proportion of his income spent is {proportion_spent} because {total_cost_cards} / {initial_money} = <<{total_cost_cards}/{initial_money}={proportion_spent}>>{proportion_spent}
This is {percentage_spent}% of his income because {proportion_spent} x {percent_multiplier} = <<{proportion_spent}*{percent_multiplier}={percentage_spent}>>{percentage_spent}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He will spend $540 on these because 18 x 30 = <<18*30=540>>540
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: The proportion of his income spent is 13.5 because 540 / 40 = <<540/40=13.5>>13.5
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: This is 1350% of his income because 13.5 x 100 = <<13.5*100=1350>>1350

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'num_students' (30) was used instead of 'cost_per_card' (2).
